meanings.sent1: She always prehandles her tasks to avoid last-minute stress.
meanings.sent2: The team prehandled the equipment before the event to ensure everything was ready.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prehandled its acorns by hiding them in various spots around the garden.
meanings.sent4: The teacher prehandled the students' questions with ease, addressing each one patiently.
meanings.sent5: Prehandling your chores can make your day run much smoother.

meanings.definition: The action or process of handling or dealing with something beforehand.
meanings.sent1: Effective prehandling of tasks can save time and effort later on.
meanings.sent2: The prehandling of customer complaints is crucial for maintaining a good reputation.
meanings.sent3: The robot's prehandling of incoming data was so efficient that it completed the task in record time.
meanings.sent4: The prehandling of luggage at the airport ensures a smooth travel experience for passengers.
meanings.sent5: The prehandling of paperwork is essential for a successful project completion.
